intro: Eutoca lutea, commonly known as the yellow eutoca, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Eutoca lutea is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
